title: Get started with Cloud Management
content:
Cloud Management simplifies the delivery, consumption, and governance of IT services and resources. The codeless and customizable interface, powered with workflow orchestration, service designer, simplified catalog, and a smart service portal, provides for the complete lifecycle management of public and private cloud resources-based IT services.

Cloud Management offers the following capabilities:

Design and deploy

Using Design and Deploy (DND), you can create service designs and offerings, and automate the provisioning and management, of hybrid and multi-cloud resources. The DND capability allows you to automate a wide variety of resource requests with an on-demand selection of parameters and options. From the Main Menu go to Build > Design. For more information, see Design and Deploy.

Before enabling and using the Design and Deploy functionality, you should have installed the Operations Orchestration Containerized capability. For more information on how to install Operations Orchestration see, Install OO on-premises, Install OO on EKS, and Install OO on AKS.

Cloud Cost Reporting

Cloud Cost Reporting provides centralized visibility into cloud spending across supported cloud platforms through prebuilt cloud cost reports. These reports help organizations analyze spending trends, identify cost drivers, and monitor cloud usage across accounts. In addition to prebuilt reports, Cloud Cost Reporting supports creating custom reports to address specific reporting needs. For more information, see Cloud Cost Reporting.

Image aggregation

Image Aggregation showcases cloud service templates from the marketplace portals of AWS, Microsoft Azure, and vCenter. As a catalog administrator, you can use the capability to easily create and publish new offerings from these templates. From the Main Menu go to Build > Design > Service Designer > Image Aggregation. For more information, see Image Aggregation.

Content Store

Content Store is part of the DND capability and is a web-based service for managing capsules. Users can download the latest capsules published on the ITOM Marketplace and use the Content Store to easily install them into the suite. Users can also use the Content Store to install custom capsules. From the main menu go to Build > Design > Content Management. For more information see Content Management.

  • offer a unified experience to manage requesting, provisioning, and consumption of IT services 
  • deliver multi-cloud infrastructure and IT services to business users
  • define the service life cycle management to provision, update, and de-provision cloud resources
  • manage hybrid and multi-cloud XaaS environments
  • orchestrate the IT operations processes end-to-end

The Cloud Management functionalities and menu visibility depend on:

  • License - You need to assign a Cloud Management license to access the functionalities. 
  • Experience mode -  The experience mode possibilities are related to the assigned licenses. For more information on how to configure the experience mode and the functionalities available, see Experience mode.
